channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Trump drops tariffs on beef, coffee, tropical fruit as pressure builds on consumer prices
item.description: President Trump's executive order comes after voters in off-year elections this month cited economic concerns as their top issue, resulting in big wins for Democrats in races in Virginia and New Jersey.
item.content:encoded:
President Trump's executive order comes after voters in off-year elections this month cited economic concerns as their top issue, resulting in big wins for Democrats in races in Virginia and New Jersey.

(Image credit: Evan Vucci)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Better late than never: The delayed September jobs report will be out next week
item.description: The Bureau of Labor Statistics says it will report on September's job gains and unemployment rate next week. That's the first of many overdue economic reports held up by the government shutdown.
item.content:encoded:
The Bureau of Labor Statistics says it will report on September's job gains and unemployment rate next week. That's the first of many overdue economic reports held up by the government shutdown.

(Image credit: Joe Raedle)
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: A storm devastated Alaska Native villages. Now their public media lost funding
item.description: A public TV and radio station in Western Alaska serves dozens of villages damaged by Typhoon Halong. But with federal funding eliminated, KYUK faces severe cuts to its staff and news department.
item.content:encoded: A public TV and radio station in Western Alaska serves dozens of villages damaged by Typhoon Halong. But with federal funding eliminated, KYUK faces severe cuts to its staff and news department.
item.dc:creator: Jeff Brady

item.title: Judge says he'll approve opioid settlement with OxyContin maker Purdue and Sackler family
item.description: A federal bankruptcy court judge said he will approve OxyContin-maker Purdue Pharma's latest deal to settle thousands of lawsuits over the toll of opioids that includes some money for thousands of victims of the epidemic.
item.content:encoded:
A federal bankruptcy court judge said he will approve OxyContin-maker Purdue Pharma's latest deal to settle thousands of lawsuits over the toll of opioids that includes some money for thousands of victims of the epidemic.

(Image credit: Stephanie Scarbrough)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: In Kansas and elsewhere, some state lawmakers are skeptical of the redistricting rush
item.description: Kansas Republican leaders couldn't rally enough support this fall for a special session on redistricting. It's just one example of lawmakers pushing back on a new round of partisan gerrymandering.
item.content:encoded:
Kansas Republican leaders couldn't rally enough support this fall for a special session on redistricting. It's just one example of lawmakers pushing back on a new round of partisan gerrymandering.

(Image credit: John Hanna)
item.dc:creator: Zane Irwin

item.title: Scientists pull ancient RNA from a woolly mammoth's body
item.description: Scientists have extracted the oldest RNA molecules out of a woolly mammoth, gaining a snapshot into the processes at work in the extinct mammal's body just before it died.
item.content:encoded:
Scientists have extracted the oldest RNA molecules out of a woolly mammoth, gaining a snapshot into the processes at work in the extinct mammal's body just before it died.

(Image credit: Valeri Plotnikov)
item.dc:creator: Ari Daniel

item.title: Seizures, broken spines and vomiting: Scientific testing that helped facilitate D-Day
item.description: Biomedical engineer Rachel Lance says British scientists submitted themselves to experiments that would be considered unethical today. Her book is Chamber Divers. Originally broadcast April, 10 2024.
item.content:encoded: Biomedical engineer Rachel Lance says British scientists submitted themselves to experiments that would be considered unethical today. Her book is Chamber Divers. Originally broadcast April, 10 2024.
item.dc:creator: Terry Gross

item.title: The Trump administration plans major shift away from long-term housing for homelessness
item.description: The overhaul shifts funds to transitional housing requiring work and addiction treatment. The administration says it promotes "self-sufficiency," but critics warn many will risk losing housing again.
item.content:encoded:
The overhaul shifts funds to transitional housing requiring work and addiction treatment. The administration says it promotes "self-sufficiency," but critics warn many will risk losing housing again.

(Image credit: Damian Dovarganes)
item.dc:creator: Jennifer Ludden

item.title: She criticized President Trump during the shutdown. Now she's been put on leave
item.description: Jenna Norton has spoken critically about the Trump administration's funding cuts and mass firings at the National Institutes of Health. At the end of the shutdown, she says she was put on leave.
item.content:encoded:
Jenna Norton has spoken critically about the Trump administration's funding cuts and mass firings at the National Institutes of Health. At the end of the shutdown, she says she was put on leave.

(Image credit: Maansi Srivastava/NPR)
item.dc:creator: Andrea Hsu

item.title: Trump to address the affordability issue. And, Border Patrol heading to Charlotte
item.description: Americans are feeling the strain of high prices, and now President Trump is preparing to take on the concern. And, Charlotte, N.C., is bracing for Border Patrol agents to arrive in the city.
item.content:encoded:
Americans are feeling the strain of high prices, and now President Trump is preparing to take on the concern. And, Charlotte, N.C., is bracing for Border Patrol agents to arrive in the city.

(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton
